* D watched Fenox, her eyes unresponsive before she shook her head.
His ears pressed flat against his skull as she rose her voice at him, 
thinking that he was picking up an angry tone.
Was he in trouble? He was only trying to help her.
He whined and moved away from the door, nodding when she asked if that was 
all he wanted to let her know.
Fenox sounded impatient and annoyed with him, making him feel bad.
If there was one thing that the people who created him could say, was that 
his feelings were hurt easily.
D wasn't use to bluntness, and was basically as helpless as a new born in 
this world.
Even though he held great power, he was shy in using it and was a kind 
heart.
But he still didn't like Vlad, though Fenox didn't seem to need him to 
protect her or anything. So he wouldn't, since she knew what was going on.
D sat down on his haunches and lowered his head, wating for Fenox to leave 
the room first. Maybe making her leave Vlad alone out there was worse then 
he thought.*
